pages.app.oldBrowserAlert.message: It looks like you're using an old browser that isn't supported. Some functionality may not work or may be broken. Please switch to a modern browser such as Firefox for full functionality.
pages.app.browser.title: RecipeSage - The Personal Recipe Keeper
pages.welcome.selfhostSubtitle: An unofficial selfhosted version of RecipeSage.com, a free recipe keeper, meal planner, and shopping list organizer for Web, iOS, and Android
pages.welcome.title: All of your recipes in one place
pages.welcome.subtitle: A free recipe keeper, meal planner, and shopping list organizer for Web, iOS, and Android
pages.welcome.description.1: RecipeSage is a free (donation based & open source) personal recipe keeper, meal planner, and shopping list manager for Web, iOS, and Android.
pages.welcome.description.2: Quickly capture and save recipes from any website simply by entering the website URL. Sync your recipes, meal plans, and shopping lists between all of your devices. Share your recipes, shopping lists, and meal plans with family and friends.
pages.welcome.description.features.1.des: Create a recipe simply by punching in a web URL
pages.welcome.description.features.2.des: Search every field within your recipes including misspellings and similar words
pages.welcome.description.features.3.des: Tag your recipes and filter by tags
pages.welcome.description.features.4.des: Schedule your meals interactively, quickly and easily
pages.welcome.description.features.5.des: Automatically categorized and intelligently grouped - add your recipes directly to a shopping list and similar items will be combined
pages.welcome.description.features.6.des: Share your recipes, collaborate on meal plans and shopping lists with your family or friends
pages.welcome.description.features.7.des: Supports Pepperplate, Living Cookbook, and Paprika
pages.welcome.description.features.8.des: Back up your recipes in multiple formats for data portability
pages.welcome.description.cta.4: Available on desktop and all mobile devices

pages.about.title: About & Support
pages.aboutDetails.title: More About Me & RecipeSage
pages.aboutDetails.1.title: A little about me
pages.aboutDetails.1.1: I'm a software developer in southern California. I do a lot of work on open source code and I spend a lot of time working on small projects.
pages.aboutDetails.1.2: RecipeSage is one of my hobbies, and I work on it in my free time alongside a lot of other projects. It's not my job and I don't make a living off of it, but it brings me a lot of joy to work on the project.
pages.aboutDetails.2.title: Why create RecipeSage?
pages.aboutDetails.2.1: I created RecipeSage to host recipes for me and my family. After trying multiple recipe programs online, I felt it would be best to create a recipe program that worked exactly as me, my mother, my girlfriend (now wife!), and my sibling wanted it to.
pages.aboutDetails.2.2: I'm a believer in open source software, and I want RecipeSage to be free to use. Everyone should be able to access and use this software, and I never want to subject RecipeSage users to ads or charge to be able to use the app.
pages.aboutDetails.2.3: If you'd like to contribute to support development, I'd really appreciate it. It's costly to run servers and host images. Contributing also unlocks some features for your account (features that are cost-prohibitive to offer for free) as a thank you.
pages.contact.title: Contact Me
pages.contact.subtitle: Contact Info
pages.contact.pleaseUserGuide: For any questions, please refer to the user guide:
pages.contact.discord: For any issues, bugs, or feature suggestions, please contact me via our Discord:
pages.contact.emailMe: Although I prefer contact via Discord since I get a lot of email, you can email me for urgent or sensitive issues at
pages.contribute.title: Contribute
pages.contribute.subtitle: Contribute to RecipeSage
pages.contribute.mission: My goal is to keep RecipeSage open to anyone, without burdening the experience with ads.
pages.contribute.purpose: However, as RecipeSage grows, hosting costs for servers and images begin to add up.
pages.contribute.monthly.description: You will unlock bonus features for the months that you are subscribed.
pages.contribute.oneTime.description: You will unlock bonus features for one year.
pages.contribute.bonus.title: As a thank you to those who make RecipeSage possible, your contributions will unlock some bonus features for your account. You will be able to:
pages.contribute.bonus.feature.2: Upload multiple images for each recipe
pages.contribute.bonus.reason: Bonus features features are accessible only to contributors because these particular features are costly for me to host.
pages.contribute.cta.1: I originally created RecipeSage for my own family to host recipes we enjoy sharing. Since then, RecipeSage has grown into a fully-fledged open source project.
pages.contribute.cta.2: Please consider contributing toward the ongoing maintenance of RecipeSage.
pages.contribute.minimum: Unfortunately the minimum amount is ${{amount}} due to transaction fees - apologies
pages.contribute.manage: To manage an existing subscription, click here
pages.contributeThankYou.title: Thank You!
pages.contributeThankYou.thanks: Thank you for being a part of the RecipeSage family and helping to keep it alive!
pages.contributeThankYou.bonus: Bonus features should be unlocked for your account shortly.
pages.contributeThankYou.questions: Please feel free to contact me with any questions, concerns or comments.
pages.contributeCancel.title: We need your help!
pages.contributeCancel.cta.1: RecipeSage is donation based - every contribution helps!
pages.contributeCancel.cta.2: Unfortunately, RecipeSage doesn't get many donations since it is a fairly small platform.
pages.contributeCancel.cta.3: In order to keep things free while paying for server costs, we need your help.
pages.contributeCancel.cta.4: Please reconsider - your contribution is truly appreciated!

pages.downloadAndInstall.subtitle: RecipeSage Application
pages.downloadAndInstall.done: This will install RecipeSage as a native application on your device.

pages.downloadAndInstall.ios.step.2: Open the share menu via a button in the bottom bar that looks like this:

pages.downloadAndInstall.desktop.instruc: To install RecipeSage on desktop or laptop devices:
pages.downloadAndInstall.desktop.step.2: Open the browser menu via the button in the top right corner that looks like this:
pages.downloadAndInstall.bookmark.instru: Drag this link to your bookmarks bar. Click the bookmark to import the current site you're on.
pages.downloadAndInstall.bookmark.descri: Automatically grabs recipe content from webpages. The browser extension is recommended instead of this bookmark.
pages.downloadAndInstall.extension.descr: Automatically grabs recipe content from webpages, and has greater compatibility across websites that might not import via the in-app importer.

pages.newLabelItemModal.title: New Label or Label Category
pages.newLabelItemModal.label: Create a label
pages.newLabelItemModal.labelDescription: Labels are the primary organization method within RecipeSage. They can be attached to recipes to organize & filter them later. Some common label examples are "breakfast", "dessert", and "vegetarian".
pages.newLabelItemModal.groupDescription: Label categories are "categories for labels" and can be used to organize multiple different labels into groups. Some examples of common label categories are: "meal", or "diet". For example, you might put the labels "breakfast", "lunch", and "dinner" under a label category called "meal".
pages.newLabelItemModal.labelTitleInputH: Many people start simple labels such as "breakfast", "dessert", or "vegetarian"

pages.manageLabelGroupModal.noLabelsSele: You haven't selected any labels to be grouped within this category. Label categories are not useful on their own - you may be looking to create a label instead.

pages.manageLabelModal.merge.message: All recipes in "{{title}}" will be relabeled with the target label instead, and the label "{{title}}" will be removed.

pages.assistant.welcome.1: Welcome to the RecipeSage cooking assistant!
pages.assistant.welcome.2: The cooking assistant is an AI model that can respond to your cooking questions and help create recipes.
pages.assistant.welcome.3: The cooking assistant has a message limit of 5 messages/day because of the high costs to run the AI. This limit is removed for contributors.
pages.assistant.welcome.4: This limit only applies to messages sent by you, and not to the AI's responses.
pages.assistant.messageLimit: Maximum messages reached (sorry, it's costly!). Message count resets at 0:00GMT.

pages.export.description3: Note: If you plan to re-import the data later, you'll need to select JSON-LD format.

pages.export.jobs.status.fail.unknown: An unknown error occurred. Please contact me.
pages.export.status.success: Export succesfully completed. Click to download.
pages.import.title: Import
pages.import.jobs.subtitle: Imports continue to run even if you close the app once started
pages.import.jobCreated.message: Your data is being imported into your account now, and you can track it's status on the import page. You won't see anything in your account until the import job is complete.
pages.import.jobs.status.fail.emptyFile: The submitted import does not contain any recognizable recipes.
pages.import.jobs.status.fail.unknown: An unknown error occurred. Please contact me.
pages.import.uploading: Uploading, please do not leave this page...
pages.import.description1: RecipeSage supports importing from Pepperplate, Living Cookbook, and Paprika.
pages.import.description2: Importing recipes will add all recipes from the file/account you've selected to your RecipeSage account.
pages.import.description3: If you're having trouble with the import, please send me an email.
pages.import.urls: Import from a list of URLs
pages.import.fileTooLarge: This file is too large to upload directly.
pages.import.fileTooLarge.contact: Please contact me to have your database imported manually.
pages.import.fileTypeWarning: Warning! This filetype does not end with: {{ acceptableFiletypes }}. It may not work.
pages.importJsonLD.title: Import Recipes from JSON-LD File
pages.importJsonLD.description: This will import a JSON-LD file (ends in .json) file into your RecipeSage account. Please note that JSON-LD is a very specific file format, and not all .json files have the correct contents to be compatible with this import method. If you're having trouble with the import, please refer to the user guide. Please consider contributing if your file contains a large number of recipes or images.
pages.importCookmate.title: Import Recipes from Cookmate File
pages.importCookmate.description: This will import a Cookmate (ends in .mcb) file into your RecipeSage account. If you're having trouble with the import, please refer to the user guide. Please consider contributing if your file contains a large number of recipes or images.
pages.importRecipeKeeper.title: Import Recipes from Recipe Keeper Export
pages.importRecipeKeeper.description: This will import a RecipeKeeper database (ends in .zip) file into your RecipeSage account. Please note that not all .zip files are compatible, only those exported from RecipeKeeper. If you're having trouble with the import, please refer to the user guide. Please consider contributing if your file contains a large number of recipes or images.
pages.importLivingCookbook.title: Import Recipes from Living Cookbook
pages.importLivingCookbook.description: This will import a LivingCookbook file (ends in .lcb, .fdx, or .fdxz) file into your RecipeSage account. If you're having trouble with the import, consider re-exporting your database (in FDX or FDXZ format), or trying the import with the "Include stock recipes" option enabled. Please consider contributing if your file contains a large number of recipes or images.
pages.importLivingCookbook.includeStock: Include stock "filler" LCB recipes (optional, not recommended)
pages.importLivingCookbook.includeTechni: Copy techniques to recipe notes (optional, not recommended)
pages.importPaprika.title: Import Recipes from Paprika File
pages.importPaprika.description: This will import a Paprika export file (ends in .paprikarecipes) file into your RecipeSage account. Please consider contributing if your file contains a large number of recipes or images.
pages.importPepperplate.title: Import Recipes from Pepperplate
pages.importPepperplate.description: This will import all recipes from your Pepperplate account into your RecipeSage account. Please consider contributing if you have a large number of recipes or images.
pages.importPepperplate.incorrectCredent: It looks like the username or password you entered for Pepperplate is incorrect.
pages.importPepperplate.username.helperT: The email or username for your Pepperplate account
pages.importPepperplate.password.helperT: The password for your Pepperplate account
pages.importTextfiles.title: Import Recipes from Zip of Text Files
pages.importTextfiles.description: This will import a set of text files compressed within a zip file (ends in .zip) into your RecipeSage account. Please refer to the user guide for how to create a file in the correct format to be imported here. Please consider contributing if your file contains a large number of recipes or images.
pages.importEnex.title: Import Recipes from Evernote (enex) File
pages.importEnex.description: This will import recipes from an Evernote export (ends in .enex) into your RecipeSage account. Please refer to the user guide for how to create a file in the correct format to be imported here. Please consider contributing if your file contains a large number of recipes or images.
pages.importUrls.title: Import Recipes from a list of URLs
pages.importUrls.description: This will attempt to import all of the URLs specified into your RecipeSage account using the autoclip functionality. Please keep in mind that some URLs may be unreachable or unparseable, and will not be imported. Please refer to the user guide for any issues. Please consider contributing if your file contains a large number of recipes or images.
pages.importUrls.urls.helperText: Each URL must be on it's own separate line. Only URLs starting with http:// and https:// are supported.
pages.importCSV.title: Import Recipes from a CSV file
pages.importCSV.description: This will import all of the recipes contained in a CSV file into your RecipeSage account. Many programs output this format, but the internal structure can be somewhat arbitrary. Please refer to the user guide if you have any issues, otherwise contact me. Please consider contributing if your file contains a large number of recipes or images.
pages.importPDFs.title: Import Recipes from PDF files
pages.importPDFs.description: This will import a set of PDF files compressed within a zip file (ends in .zip) into your RecipeSage account. Please refer to the user guide for how to create a file in the correct format to be imported here. Please consider contributing if your file contains a large number of recipes or images.
pages.importImages.title: Import Recipes from image files
pages.importImages.description: This will import a set of image files compressed within a zip file (ends in .zip) into your RecipeSage account. Please refer to the user guide for how to create a file in the correct format to be imported here. Please consider contributing if your file contains a large number of recipes or images.

pages.settings.section2.title: General Settings
pages.settings.splitPane: Enable Split Pane View on Large Screens
pages.settings.language.contribute: Contact me to contribute a language
pages.settings.resetCompletion: Reset Recipe Ingredient and Instruction Completion + Scale
pages.settings.resetCompletion.header: Reset Recipe Ingredient and Instruction Completion + Scale
pages.settings.resetCompletion.message: This will clear all of the saved ingredient/instruction completion (items marked as complete in your recipes), as well as any scaling you've set on your recipes.
pages.settings.preferencesSync.message: You must select whether you want to override the synced settings in the cloud with the local settings on this device, or override the settings on this device with the settings from the cloud.
pages.settings.resetPrefs.message: Resetting your preferences will set all app preferences back to their default state. This includes preferences set via menus on the home page, meal plans page, shopping list page, etc. Note: This only affects this device.
pages.settings.oled.message: The black (OLED) theme may make it difficult to distinguish between elements and alerts. Shadows and other visual animations will also not be displayed.
pages.settings.sync.message: You will see a notification pop up when the sync has completed if you have enabled notification permissions for the app via the messaging page.
pages.settings.mealOptions.description: Customize your meal options to suit your dietary preferences and schedule. Manage and organize your meals efficiently with our intuitive meal options settings.
pages.settings.mealOptions.new.title: Create a new meal option
pages.settings.mealOptions.new.descripti: Create a new meal option to customize your meal planning experience. Add, edit, or remove meal options to suit your dietary preferences and schedule.
pages.settings.mealOptions.new.titleInpu: e.g. breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, etc.
pages.settings.mealOptions.new.timeInput: Enter the time for your meal option
This will be used to identify your meal option in the meal calendar.
pages.settings.mealOptions.manage.title: Manage {{name}}
pages.settings.mealOptions.update.placeh: Enter the new title and time for your meal option
pages.settings.mealOptions.updateConflic: A meal option with this title and time already exists. Please choose a different title or time.
sync.notification.title: Offline Sync Complete
sync.notification.body: Your content has been cached for offline use, and will be kept up-to-date automatically.
pages.share.title: Share Recipe
pages.share.description: When sharing, a copy of this recipe will be sent to the recipient. Your copy will not be affected.
pages.share.byAccount.description: Recipient must have a RecipeSage account. If you'd like to share with a non-RecipeSage user, use the link sharing option.
pages.share.byEmbed.copy: Copy the code below and paste it into your website HTML
pages.newShoppingListItem.title: Add item(s)
pages.newShoppingList.title: New shopping list
pages.updateShoppingList.title: Update shopping list
pages.shoppingList.title: Shopping List - {{title}}
pages.shoppingList.nullState.1: There are no items in this shopping list.
pages.shoppingList.nullState.2: Use the menu in the upper right hand corner to enable or disable automatic grouping.
pages.shoppingList.removeMultiple.messag: This will permanently delete these items from this list.
pages.shoppingListPopover.options.title: Options
pages.shoppingListPopover.sortBy.title: Title
pages.shoppingListPopover.actions.title: Actions
pages.shoppingListPopover.removeAll.head: Confirm Removal
pages.shoppingListPopover.removeAll.mess: This will permanently delete all items from this list. This action is irreversible.
pages.shoppingListPopover.deleteList.mes: This will permanently remove this shopping list from your account. Note: If you're only a collaborator on this list, it'll only be removed from your account. If you own this list, it will be removed from all other collaborators accounts.
pages.shoppingLists.title: Shopping Lists
pages.shoppingLists.nullState.2: To create a shopping list, press the plus button in the bottom corner.
pages.shoppingListIgnoreModal.title: Shopping List Item Ignore List
pages.shoppingListIgnoreModal.descriptio: Items listed here will be automatically excluded when adding a recipe to a shopping list. This is particularly handy for ingredients such as salt, which you likely don't need added every time you add an item to a shopping list.
pages.shoppingListIgnoreModal.instructio: Each entry should be on it's own line. Entries will match an ingredient if the ingredient contains any part of the line. If you enter "salt", it will match "1 tbsp sea salt finely ground".
pages.shoppingListIgnoreModal.label: Ignore list
pages.shoppingListIgnoreModal.placeholde: Keywords to ignore, each on their own line
pages.addFriendModal.title: Find User
pages.addFriendModal.profileWarning: Note: The desired user must have enabled their profile.
pages.addFriendModal.profileDisabled.mes: This user has disabled their profile and is therefore private/inaccessible.
pages.addProfileItem.title: Add Profile Item
pages.addProfileItem.prompt: What Would You Like to Share?
pages.addProfileItem.label: A Label
pages.addProfileItem.type.label: Label
pages.addProfileItem.selectVisibility: Who Should Be Able to See This?
pages.addProfileItem.tos: By adding this item, you agree to the RecipeSage Sharing Policy
pages.myProfile.title: Edit Profile
pages.myProfile.setup1: Before you get started, there are a few things that you'll need to set up.
pages.myProfile.setup.name: First, choose the name or nickname to be shown on your profile.
pages.myProfile.name: Name/Nickname
pages.myProfile.setup2: Now, choose the handle for your profile, for example: @superchef
pages.myProfile.handle.unique: Note: Handle must be unique, and must not contain any special characters.
pages.myProfile.nullState.1: You have nothing on your profile yet.
pages.myProfile.nullState.2: To add your first profile item, click the "add" button to the right.
pages.myProfile.notEnabled.message: You'll need to enable your profile to interact with sharing features, such as sending friend requests.
pages.myProfile.share.unsaved.message: You'll need to save your changes before you can share your profile.
You'll need to save your changes before you can view what your profile looks like.
pages.people.title: People
pages.people.nullState.1: You haven't set up a profile.
pages.people.nullState.2: Creating a profile allows you to share collections of recipes with friends and the public.
pages.people.noFriends.1: You don't have any friends added.
pages.people.noFriends.2: Adding someone as a friend allows you to collaborate on recipes, meal plans, and shopping lists.
pages.people.noFriends.3: To add someone, click the search icon.
pages.people.setup.message: You'll need to setup your profile before you can go adding friends.

pages.profile.nullState: {{name}} hasn't added anything to their profile yet.
pages.profile.setup: Setup Your Profile to Add Friend
pages.profile.disabled.message: This user has disabled their profile and is therefore private/inaccessible.
pages.profile.setup.message: To add this user as a friend, you need to setup your profile.
pages.profile.alreadyRequested: It looks like you already have a friendship in progress. Please try again.

pages.shareProfileModal.shareBody: Click to view {{name}}'s public RecipeSage profile:

components.messaging.notificationPermiss: To notify you when your contacts send you messages, we need notification access. After dismissing this popup, you will be prompted to enable notification access.
components.messaging.shoppingList.catego: Selecting edit allows you to drag-and-drop shopping list items to a new category

services.quickTutorial.multipleRecipeSel: You're now in multiple recipe selection mode. You can click as many recipes as you'd like to select, then use the buttons that appear in the header to take bulk actions such as labelling or deleting. You can exit multiple recipe selection mode at any time by clicking the X in the header, or via the options menu.
services.quickTutorial.multipleLabelSele: You're now in multiple label selection mode. You can click as many labels as you'd like to select, then use the buttons that appear in the header to take bulk actions. You can exit multiple label selection mode at any time by clicking the X in the header, or via the options menu.
services.quickTutorial.splitPaneView.mes: Split pane view is only visible on devices with large screens (laptops, large tablets, etc). When split pane view is enabled, the side menu will always be visible. This feature is useful for optimizing the experience on larger devices.
services.quickTutorial.pinnedRecipes.mes: This recipe is now pinned! Pinning recipes provides a quick way to jump between multiple recipes quickly while cooking. Pinned recipes appear in the toolbar at the bottom of the screen. You'll see a bubble with the recipe image and the first letter of the recipe title. Pinned recipes will stay open until they are unpinned or until you close the application.
services.unsavedChanges.message: It looks like you have been editing something. If you leave before saving, your changes will be lost.
errors.offline: A connectivity error occurred. While offline, you're only able to do read-only actions, and view content if your device has it cached locally.
errors.unexpected: An unexpected error occurred and the app may not work correctly. Please reload the app and try again. If this continues to occur, please contact me.
errors.unexpected.selfhost: An unexpected error occurred. Please check your server logs as well as the self hosting FAQ.
